相手に気に入られようと、こびへつらうこと。

row.english: ① Smooth sailing ② Endless chatter

row.notes: 安閑・恬静 = peaceful and tranquil

row.notes: Yan Zi (晏子) has high高 morals節; When Cui Zhu (崔杼) of Qi (斉) wanted to claim power through assassination, Yan Zi rebuked him saying 'The immoral man will surely face divine judgement.'
row.jpn: 中国春秋時代、斉の晏嬰が臣下としての節を全うしたこと。

row.notes: Grafting cattail蒲 to the wheels輪 for safety安 to a cart車 used to transport the elderly
row.jpn: 老人をいたわり手厚く遇する例え。

row.english: An impractical idea or plan; Good on paper, not in practice
row.notes: Seeking索 to purchase a stallion驥 using a drawing図 as guide按

row.english: An impractical idea or plan; Good on paper, not in practice
row.notes: Seeking索 to purchase a stallion驥 using a drawing図 as guide按
row.jpn: 理論だけの実際には役立たない考えや意見のこと。

row.english: Military apparatus for reporting confidential information directly to the Emperor
row.notes: Existed under former Imperial law; 帷幄=curtains metaphorically referring to military HQ
row.jpn: 旧憲法下で、軍事の機密事項について直接天皇に上奏すること。

row.english: Doing whatever it takes to realize your ambition
row.notes: Yi Yin(伊尹) carried負 a cauldron鼎 upon his back to gain the attention of the Cheng Tang of Shang and eventually become prime minister
row.jpn: 大望の為に身を落とす例え。

row.notes: Spirits意気 sinking銷沈; Also 意気消沈
row.ant: 意気軒昂,意気衝天,意気揚揚
row.jpn: 元気を失くして、しょげかえること。

row.notes: Spirits意気 dejected沮喪; Also 意気阻喪
row.ant: 意気軒昂,意気衝天,意気揚揚
row.jpn: 意気込みがくじけ弱り、元気を失うこと。

row.notes: Wear clothing衣 of brocade錦 and add尚 a robe絅 on top
row.jpn: 才能や徳を外にあらわに出さないこと。

row.notes: During the Warring State Period in China, Ximen Bao (西豹門) wished to soften his bad temper and wore佩 a soft leather韋 strap as a reminder. During the Spring and Autumn Period, Dongan Yu (董安于) wanted to straighten up and stop being lazy and tied a bowstring弦 to himself as a reminder.
row.jpn: 自分の性格を改めて修養しようと戒めの為の物を身に着けること。

row.notes: Attaching傅 wings翼 for為 a tiger虎
row.jpn: 強い者に更に力を付けること。
意識が霞んではっきりしないさま。

row.notes: 意匠=designing/planning; 惨憺=agony; Also 意匠惨憺
row.syn: 苦心惨憺,焦唇乾舌,粒粒辛苦
row.jpn: 工夫を凝らすのに苦心すること。

row.english: Thinking of a close friend who is far away
row.notes: From a poem by Du Fu, who lived by the trees樹 beside the Wei渭 River, written about his friend Li Bai(李白), who was exiled from the area and living under the clouds雲 above Yangtze江 River
row.jpn: 遠くに居る友人を想う情が切な事。

row.notes: Running走 like Skanda韋駄天, a Buddhist guardian deity known for great speed
row.jpn: 非常に速く走ること。

row.notes: One一 cup觴 one一 reading詠; Wang Xizhi (王羲之) enjoyed hosting dinners outside Shaoxing (紹興) where he would drink and write poetry with his peers
row.jpn: ひと杯の酒を飲んで、一つの詩を作る。酒を飲み楽しみながら詩を作ること。

row.notes: A single一 character字 can both praise褒 and criticize貶
row.jpn: 一字の使い分けによって、人を誉めたり貶したりすること。

row.notes: A一 view望 with no無 limit垠
row.syn: 一望千頃,天涯一望,一望千里
row.jpn: 一目で彼方まで広々と見渡されること。

row.notes: 7,700kg千鈞 hanging from a single一 thread縷
row.jpn: 危険の甚だしい事の形容。

row.english: Jackpot; Reaping huge rewards for little effort
row.notes: 1,000千 gold金 in one一 take攫
row.jpn: あまり苦労をせずに一時に大きい利益を得ること。
家族と血縁関係にある者。

row.notes: 一家 is a clan or family. 団欒 is a group or circle.
row.jpn: 家族が集まって睦まじく楽しむこと。

row.english: Complete a composition in one sitting; Finishing without stopping
row.notes: Complete成 in one一 breath気 before you exhale呵
row.jpn: 一息に文章を書き上げること。また、物事を中断する事なく一息に仕上げてしまうこと。

row.notes: The Duke of Zhou (周公旦) was so passionate about hiring quality sages that he would welcome them in at any time, even if it meant rising起 ten十 times during one一 dinner饋 to greet them
row.jpn: 賢者を求めるのに熱心なたとえ。

row.english: ① The homestretch, or last piece of the puzzle ② Every little bit helps
row.notes: The success功 of之 one一 basket簣; A mountain isn't finished until the final basket of soil is poured on top. Also, every single basket is important to completing the whole.
row.syn: 功虧一簣,九仭一簣,為山止簣
row.jpn: 仕事を完遂する間際の最後の努力。最後のひとふんばり。

row.notes: Finding happiness with but a single一 hill丘 and a single一 valley壑
row.jpn: 俗世間を離れ、自然の中に身を置いて、風流を楽しむこと。

row.english: Poverty; Owning nothing but the clothes on your back
row.notes: Owning a single一 coat裘 of fur and a single一 shirt of kudzu葛
row.jpn: 一枚のかわごろもと、一枚のくずかたびら。他に着替えが無い事から、貧乏のたとえ。

row.notes: Badgers貉 of之 a single一 hill丘
row.jpn: 同じ丘に棲むむじな。似たような者の」たとえ。

row.english: All good things come to an end, but bad things are more stubborn
row.notes: The pungent stench of one一 spirea蕕 will overpower the sweet aroma of one一 gooseneck薫
row.jpn: 善は消えやすく悪は除きがたい事の例え。

row.notes: Stumble蹶 once一 and not不 move振 again
row.jpn: 一度失敗して二度と立ち上がれない例え。

row.english: Rise and fall; Ebb and flow
row.notes: Once一 open闢, once一 closed闔
row.jpn: あるいは閉じ、あるいは開く。陰と陽が消長するさま。

row.notes: Fur from the armpit腋 of之 a一 fox狐
row.jpn: 貴重な物の例え。

row.notes: One一 thread糸, one一 hair毫
row.jpn: ごく僅かなこと。

row.english: Speaking truth to power; One brave voice among a silent crowd
row.notes: One一 warrior士, 諤諤=speaking frankly
row.jpn: 多くの者が阿り追従している中で、一人だけ恐れ憚らずに直言すること。

row.english: ① Silky smooth writing/speech ② Swift progress
row.notes: One一 flow瀉 of water reaching 1000千 miles里
row.jpn: 流れの非常に速いこと。転じて、文章や弁舌がよどみなく、すらすらできる事の例え。また、物事が速やかに進み片付くこと。

row.notes: One一 cup觴 one一 reading詠; Wang Xizhi (王羲之) enjoyed hosting dinners outside Shaoxing (紹興) where he would drink and write poetry with his peers
row.jpn: ひと杯の酒を飲んで、一つの詩を作る。酒を飲み楽しみながら詩を作ること。

row.english: The slightest reaction; The slightest hint of emotion on one's face
row.notes: One一 smile笑, one一 grimace嚬
row.jpn: 顔に現れる僅かな表情。ちょっと顔を顰めたり、ちょっと笑ったりすること。

row.notes: One一 recitation倡, 3三 cries歎 of emotion
row.jpn: 優れた詩文を賞賛する語。一度詠み上げれば何度も感嘆する意。

row.notes: A一 generation世. 風靡=bending to the influence
row.jpn: ある時代に非常に流行すること。

row.english: ① An excellent shot ② Killing two birds with one stone
row.notes: One一 arrow箭 two双 eagles雕
row.syn: 一挙両得,一石二鳥,一発双貫,一挙双擒
row.jpn: 弓を射るのがうまいこと。また、ただ一つの行為で二つの利益を得るたとえ。

row.english: It has its pros and cons
row.notes: One一 drawback短, one一 merit長
row.jpn: 長所もあり短所もあり、完全でないこと。

row.notes: A一 morning朝 of之 anger忿; 一朝 means a short period of time
row.jpn: 一時的な怒りをいう。
豪快な振る舞い、思い切りの良い事のたとえ。

row.notes: A single一 thread of hair髪 with 1000千 x 7.7kg鈞 of weight hanging from it
row.syn: 一縷千鈞,危機一髪,一触即発
row.jpn: 非常に危険なこと、極めて無理なことのたとえ。

row.english: The slightest reaction; The slightest hint of emotion
row.notes: One一 smile笑, one一 grimace嚬
row.jpn: 顔に現れる僅かな表情。ちょっと顔を顰めたり、ちょっと笑ったりすること。

row.english: Two dogs fight for a bone and the third runs away with it
row.notes: Quarrel争 of之 the sandpiper鷸 and mussel蚌. While the sandpiper and mussel fight, the fisherman strolls up and captures them both. In the Warring States period, King Zhao (昭王) of Yan燕 beseeched Su Dai (蘇代) to convince King Huiwen (恵文王) of Zhao趙 not to attack. Su Dai did so using this parable, saying that a fight between Zhao and Yan would allow the Qin秦 state to destroy them both.
row.jpn: 両者が譲らずに争っていると第三者が骨を折らずに利益を横取りしてしまう事のたとえ。

row.notes: The wealth富 of之 Yi Dun (猗頓). Yi Dun was a premier example of a 'rich person' in China during the Spring and Autumn period. After struggling as a farmer, he raised livestock for 10 years and amassed a great fortune.
row.jpn: 巨万の富、膨大な財産をいう。

row.notes: Stand倚 before a horse馬 and write 7七 pages紙. Refers to Yuan Hu (袁虎), who when commanded by Huan Wen (桓温) to write an edict, is able to bang out 7 pages while standing by his horse, i.e., on his way off to battle. Similar to saying 'on his way out the door,' as opposed to sitting at a desk and concentrating.
row.jpn: すらすらと名文を書き上げる才能。

row.notes: The various tribes surrounding China's borders. 夷=Eastern tribes, 蛮=Southern tribes, 戎=Western tribes, 狄=Northern tribes
row.jpn: 中国周辺部に居た異民族の総称。四方の野蛮民族。えびす。

row.notes: Wei渭 river浜 fisherman漁父. Refers to Lu Shang (呂尚), known as the Hopeful Grand Duke (太公望). He was discovered by King Wen, who followed a prophecy and found Lu Shang dropping a fishing line on the bank of Wei River.
row.jpn: 渭水の畔で釣り糸を垂れていた呂尚（太公望）のこと。

row.notes: Wither萎 weaken靡 sink沈 stagnate滞
row.jpn: 物事の動きに活気や勢いが無いこと。

row.notes: 異・奇=rare, unheard of + 聞・譚=talk, news
row.jpn: 極めて珍しい話のこと。

row.english: ① Indulging in a good read over and over ② Immersed in study
row.notes: Break絶 the leather strap(韋編) on a book three三 times
row.jpn: 書物を繰り返し読むこと。読者や学問に熱心なたとえ。

row.kun: 門(もん)に倚(よ)りかかって待ち望(のぞ)む
row.english: A mother waiting anxiously for her child to return home
row.notes: From the state of Wei during the Spring and Autumn period. When Wangsun Chi (王孫賈) left home each day, his mother would always [lean against>倚 the gate as gaze望 into the distance waiting for his return.
row.jpn: 子を思う母の愛情のこと。

row.english: Harmony and balance between things of opposing nature
row.notes: Different異 types類, but no無 obstacle礙 between them
row.jpn: 異質な物同士が、なんの障害も無く互いに通じ合うこと。

row.notes: Cause因 and effect果 witnessed [right before your eyes>覿面
row.jpn: 悪事の報いがすぐに目の前に現れること。

row.english: ① A wise man learns from the mistakes of others ② Those who choose to ignore history are doomed to repeat it
row.notes: The Yin殷 Dynasty was advised to reflect鑑 upon lessons not不 far遠 in the past, specifically, the destruction of the Xia dynasty just prior
row.jpn: 失敗を戒める例は近くにあるたとえ。

row.english: A life of debauchery and violence
row.notes: 婬虐=debauchery; 暴戻=violence, lawlessness; 婬⇔淫
row.jpn: 淫らな生活をし、乱暴で非道なこと。

row.english: ① Insincere politeness ② Overly polite to the point of being insulting
row.notes: Overwhelming politeness慇 and courtesy懃 to a level as to be not無 polite礼
row.jpn: 表面は極めて礼儀正しく丁寧であるが、実はひどく尊大であること。又、言葉遣いや態度などが丁寧過ぎるのは、かえって無礼であること。

row.english: An area of land vital to national defense
row.notes: As important as a throat咽喉 or right右 elbow臂
row.jpn: 極めて緊要な地。

row.english: ① Following convention ② Playing it safe
row.notes: [Following convention>因循 as a makeshift苟且 solution
row.jpn: 古い習慣や方法に拘って、その場しのぎの手段をとること。又、決断力に欠け、ぐずぐずしてためらうさま。

row.english: ① Following convention ② Playing it safe
row.notes: [Following convention>因循 as a makeshift姑息 solution
row.jpn: 古い習慣や方法に拘って、その場しのぎの手段をとること。又、決断力に欠け、ぐずぐずしてためらうさま。

row.english: Not thinking ahead; Doing something dangerous or harmful to satisfy an immediate need
row.notes: Drinking飲 poison鴆 to stop止 one's thirst渇

row.english: A deceitful plan or scheme; Treachery
row.notes: 陰謀=planning in the shadows; 詭計=treachery
row.jpn: 人を欺く為のひそかな悪巧み。

row.notes: 烏・焉 and 魯・魚 are both pairs of similar-looking characters that could be easily mistaken for each other.
row.syn: 魯魚之謬,魯魚亥豕,魯魚陶陰,魯魚帝虎,烏焉成馬,魯魚章草,亥豕之譌,焉馬之誤,三豕渡河
row.jpn: 文字の書き誤り。

row.english: ① Life at sea ② Life as a nomad
row.notes: Floating浮 house家, floating泛 house宅, either ① literally, or ② metaphorically
row.jpn: 船を住宅として海の上の生活をすること。又、一定の住居に滞在せずにさまよう隠者の生活をすること。

row.english: Charitable deeds done in secret will be rewarded openly
row.notes: Build high高 Yu Gong(于公)'s gate門. Yu Gong was a judge during the Han Dynasty who was well-known for being fair and just. When the gate to his home was damaged, the people rushed to his aid. Instead of simple repairs, they rebuilt it taller and grander than before, believing that the accumulated karma of such an honorable man would certainly benefit his descendants. Therefore, a large gate was needed to fit the massive carriages of his sure-to-be wealthy and successful offspring.
row.jpn: 陰徳を積む家の子孫は繁栄する事のたとえ。

row.english: Simply emulating great people does not earn one their honor and virtue
row.notes: 禹=Yu the Great; 舜=Emperor Shun; Simply imitating them by acting行 accordingly趨 is not enough
row.jpn: 禹や舜の表面上の動作を真似るだけで実質的な聖人の徳を備えていないこと。

row.notes: Looking顧 right右 and glancing眄 left左
row.syn: 左顧右盼,右顧左顧,左右傾側,首鼠両端
row.jpn: 右を見たり左を見たりためらい迷うこと。情勢を気にして決断できないこと。

row.notes: Holding a wing羽-shaped fan扇 and wearing a silk hood綸巾
row.jpn: 冷静沈着。

row.english: A solution with no pratical application or benefit
row.jpn: 回りくどく実際に適応できないこと。事情に疎く実際に役に立たないこと。

row.notes: Eating stinky鬱 rotted meat肉 or [dried meat>脯 leaking漏 a foul odor to stave off hunger
row.jpn: 腐った肉や腐った脯（ほじし）。

row.english: Yu the Great, King Tang, King Wen and King Wu
row.notes: Yu禹 the Great, first ruler of the Xia夏 dynasty; Tang湯, first ruler of the Yin殷 era; King Wen文 and King Wu武, first rulers of the Zhou周 dynasty.
row.jpn: 夏・殷・周三代の始祖の名。

row.notes: The 3-legged crow烏 that lives in the sun and rabbit兎 of the moon [rush hurriedly>怱怱. These mythical animals represent the sun and moon, i.e., the passage of time. 怱怱⇔匆匆
row.jpn: 歳月が速く過ぎ去るたとえ。

row.notes: Mother嫗 bird laying伏 upon its eggs. Mammal going from pregnancy孕 to fostering鬻 growth of a child. 鬻⇔育
row.jpn: 鳥や獣が子を産み育てること。

row.english: Simply emulating great people does not earn one their honor and virtue
row.notes: 禹=Yu the Great; 舜=Emperor Shun; Simply imitating them by walking歩 in their footsteps and acting accordingly趨 is not enough
row.jpn: 禹や舜の表面上の動作を真似るだけで実質的な聖人の徳を備えていないこと。

row.english: Mountains or trees winding into the distance
row.notes: 紆余=winding and streching into the distance. 委蛇=curving and winding
row.jpn: 山や林などがウネウネと屈曲しながら長く続くさま。

row.english: ① Curving and bending ② A complicated situation
row.notes: 紆余=winding path. 曲折=curving and bending
row.jpn: 曲がりくねること。又、事情が込み入り複雑なこと。

row.english: ① O-Bon festival (Japan) ② Hungry Ghost Festival (Japan)
row.jpn: 仏教で七月十五日に祖先の霊を祀り冥福を祈る行事。

row.kun: 雨(あめ)に濡れた笠(かさ)、煙(もや)の中の簑(みの)
row.english: The figure of a lone hermit or fisherman
row.notes: A rain雨-soaked [bamboo rainhat>笠 or [bamboo coat>簑 in the mist煙
row.jpn: 俗世から離れて、仙人として生活をする。

row.english: Emperor Xuanzong's song: 'The Rains and the Bells'
row.notes: While Emperor Xuanzong (玄宗) of Tang travelled to quell the An-Shi rebellion, he was forced to put to death his beloved consort, Yang Guifei (楊貴忌), whose family was blamed for the uprising. As he mourned, the sounds of the rains雨霖 coupled with the bells鈴 on his horse inspired him to create a song in remembrance of his fallen love.
row.jpn: 唐の玄宗の作った楽曲の名。

row.notes: Wu Shan (巫山) is a mountain said to harbor prostitutes located in Hubei Province, while clouds雲 and rain雨 are euphamisms for feminine sexuality. In the Warring States Period, King Huai (懐王) dreamt of having intercourse with a Wu Shan prostitue, who claimed she was the 'morning clouds and evening rain.'
row.syn: 巫山之夢,巫山之雨,雲雨之夢,朝雲暮雨,尤雲殢雨
row.jpn: 男女の情交をいう。

row.notes: Like how clouds雲 and smoke烟 simply float past過 your eye眼
row.jpn: 物事に深く執着しないたとえ。

row.notes: Like clouds雲 or smoke(fog)烟 stretching for 10,000万 miles里.
row.jpn: 非常に遠く離れている事のたとえ。

row.notes: Flies飛 and moves動 like clouds雲 or smoke(mist)烟.
row.jpn: 筆勢が躍動して力強い事のたとえ。

row.reading: うんえんひょうびょう
row.notes: Couds雲 and smoke(mist)烟 indistinct縹渺 in the distance.
row.jpn: 雲や霞が遠く棚引くさま。

row.english: ① Going where the wind takes you ② A travelling monk
row.notes: Roaming遊 freely like the clouds雲, heading寄 where life takes you as if weeds萍 flowing down a river
row.jpn: 物事に執着せず、自然のままに行動すること。又、諸国を修行してまわる僧のこと。

row.english: Best wishes for a lifetime of love and happiness
row.notes: May the husband伉 and wife儷 prosper栄 together諧
row.jpn: 栄えて仲の良い夫婦のこと。結婚の賀詞。

row.notes: Someone who is is spooked駭 by a shadow影 or trembles震 at the slightest noise響
row.jpn: 酷く驚き恐れること。ちょっとしたものに驚くこと。
男らしく凛々しい容姿で、非常に爽やかなこと。

row.english: ① Distorting the meaning of something ② Finding hidden meaning where there is none
row.notes: A resident of the city of Ying郢 sent a letter書 to the ruler of the state of Yan燕 asking to 'raise the lights,' but the ruler interpreted説 his request as 'improve the intelligence' and promoted intellectuals to the state assembly.

row.english: ① One destined to tame the farlands ② The look of a fierce warrior
row.notes: Ban Chao (班超) of the Eastern Han Dynasty was born with a jaw頷 like a sparrow燕 beak and face頸 like a tiger虎. Initially working as bureaucrat, Chao was inspired by Zhang Qian (張鶱) to throw away the pen and pick up the sword. Ban Chao claimed many victories beyond the Great Wall and was awarded the title 'Protector General of the Western Regions.'

The dream夢 of之 Hantan邯鄲. From the parable "The World Inside a Pillow" set in Hantan邯鄲, the capital of Zhao during the Warring States Period. Traveling monk Rosei (盧生) receives a pillow枕 from an old Daoist, Rosen (呂扇). Rosei sleeps upon the pillow and dreams an entire lifetime of success and riches. However, his success invites jealousy and hate, and he is betrayed and spends his final days in imprisoned with nothing. Upon dying, he awakens to find that while he experienced an entire lifetime, back in the real world, the old man had yet to even finish cooking炊 a single一 meal of yellow黄 rice粱. Rosei realizes the futility of striving so hard for fortune and fame when life is but a moment in time. A number of idioms including terms like 邯鄲, 一炊, 黄粱 and 盧生 reference this story.

row.notes: The dog狗 barks吠 at black緇 clothing衣. From a story about Yang Zhu (楊朱) philosopher of the Warring States period. Yang Zhu's brother, Yang Pu (楊布) leaves home in his usual white attire and is caught in the rain, so he changes to black clothing before returning home. As Yang Pu enters, their dog doesn't recognize this new black-clad fellow and barks at him. Yang Pu is about to strike the dog, but Yang Zhu intervenes saying it's natural the dog should bark. If a white dog were covered in mud and appeared black, you would be similarly confused.

row.english: ① Random wanton promotion of unqualified officials ② A shoddy or inferior follow-up
row.notes: Dog狗 tails尾 following続 sable貂. During the Western Jin (西晋) dynasty, Sima Lun (司馬倫) usurped the throne and promoted his followers and hangers-on to prominent positions in government. Such officials customarily had sable tails affixed to their headgear, but with such an influx of new people, they had to start substituting in dog tails. This became an object of ridicule and the sable to dog tail progression a symbol of a shoddy or inferior follow-up.

row.notes: One一 cooking炊 session of yellow黄 rice粱. From the parable "The World Inside a Pillow" set in Hantan邯鄲, the capital of Zhao during the Warring States Period. Traveling monk Rosei (盧生) receives a pillow枕 from an old Daoist, Rosen (呂扇). Rosei sleeps upon the pillow and dreams an entire lifetime of success and riches. However, his success invites jealousy and hate, and he is betrayed and spends his final days in imprisoned with nothing. Upon dying, he awakens to find that while he experienced an entire lifetime, back in the real world, the old man had yet to even finish cooking炊 a single一 meal of yellow黄 rice粱. Rosei realizes the futility of striving so hard for fortune and fame when life is but a moment in time. A number of idioms including terms like 邯鄲, 一炊, 黄粱 and 盧生 reference this story.

row.english: Yang Zhu's and Mozi's lamentations over good and evil

Yang Zhu wailed哭 at the fork岐 in the road, observing that as people choose which path to take, so too do they choose their paths in life, yet some people choose evil. Mozi cried泣 over the silk twine練, observing that while all its threads are white at first, they could be dyed any color, which permanently changed them. In this way, people are not inherently good or evil, but shaped by their circumstances.

row.notes: Sit坐 upon firewood薪 and hang嘗 gall胆 bladder. From the Spring and Autumn Period. King Helu of Wu (呉王闔閭) attempts to invade the State of Yue越 but is beaten back by King Goujian of Yue (越王勾践) and succumbs to his injuries. On his deathbed, Helu tells his successor, King Fuchai of Wu (呉王夫差), to exact revenge. Fuchai bides his time, laying臥 upon firewood薪 every night to keep thoughts of revenge on his mind. Fuchai then defeats Goujian upon Mt. Xianglu (会稽山). Goujian then hangs懸 gall胆 bladder in his room to taste its bitterness and keep thoughts of revenge fresh in his mind and finally exacts in 20 years later when he defeats Fucha and causes him to commit suicide.

row.notes: The trust信 of之 moving徙 the tree木. When Shang Yang (商鞅) reformed the laws of the State of Qin, he made a proclamation that whoever moved the tree at the South gate to the North gate would receive 10 gold. The people doubted him, so he raised the reward to 50 gold, which was enough to entice someone to move the tree. Shang Yang then rewarded this person as promised to show the people they could have faith in the new laws.

Burning燃 the beanstalks萁 to boil煮 the beans豆. Refers to Cao Zhi (曹植) of the Three Kingdoms period. Emperor Cao Pi (曹丕) of the state of Cao Wei thought his brother Cao Zhi was plotting to usurp him. Cao Pi commanded Cao Zhi to prove his innocence by crafting a poem in just seven steps. Cao Zhi recited a poem about beans weeping as their beanstalks are burned for fuel to boil them. This is the basis for the idiom 煮豆燃萁, an allegory for brothers needlessly quarreling and destroying each other. The imagery so moved Cao Pi, that he let his brother go.

row.notes: Bian He (卞和) crying泣 over a jewel璧. Bian He finds a stone in the mountains and presents it to King Li of Zhou (周厲王). The King doubts its value and punishes Bian He by cutting off his left leg. Bian He then presents the stone to King Wu of Zhou (周武王), who also doubts its value and punishes Bian He by cutting off his right leg. Finally, Bian He presents the stone to King Wen of Zhou (周文王) who polishes it to reveal its true value as a jewel, which is made into a national treasure. Bian He's jewel璧 is also said to be the origin of the term 完璧 'perfect.'

row.notes: From a story about Nanguo(南郭), a terrible [reed mouth organ>(竽) player, who lived during the Warring States period of China. At the time, King Xuan of Qi(齊宣王) loved to hear concerts by groups of people 300 large. so Nanguo could arbitrarily(濫) play whatever, and there was a sufficient(充) number(数) of people to cover him. However, the next ruler, King Min of Qi(齊湣王), preferred solo performances, and so Nanguo fled.
